mftools.measure package

Submodules

mftools.measure.grain_size module

Automatic grain size measurement functions following [1]. Each function takes a binary image as input.

References

1

ASTM E1382−97 (2015) Standard Test Methods for Determining Average Grain Size Using Semiautomatic and Automatic Image Analysis

mftools.measure.grain_size.chord_length(image, um_per_px, n_scans, min_length)[source]

Perform intercept (chord) length method with randomly orientated scan lines.

Parameters

  • image (ndarray) – Binary image.

  • um_per_px (float) – Scaling (um per pixel).

  • n_scans (int) – Number of randomly orientated line scans to perform.

  • min_length (float) – Minimum scan line length to include in measurements (um).

Returns

cl – List of chord lengths.

Return type

list of float

References

1

ASTM E1382−97 (2015) Standard Test Methods for Determining Average Grain Size Using Semiautomatic and Automatic Image Analysis

mftools.measure.grain_size.chord_length_uniform(image, um_per_px, n_scans)[source]

Perform intercept (chord) length method with uniform grid of scan lines.

Parameters

  • image (ndarray) – Binary image.

  • um_per_px (float) – Scaling (um per pixel).

  • n_scans (int) – Number of line scans in both the horizontal and vertical direction.

Returns

cl – List of chord lengths.

Return type

list of float

mftools.measure.grain_size.grain_areas(image, um_per_px)[source]

Perform individual grain area method.

Parameters

  • image (ndarray) – Binary image.

  • um_per_px (float) – Scaling (um per pixel).

Returns

ga – List of grain areas.

Return type

list of float

References

1

ASTM E1382−97 (2015) Standard Test Methods for Determining Average Grain Size Using Semiautomatic and Automatic Image Analysis

mftools.measure.grain_size.grain_count(image, um_per_px)[source]

Perform intersection count method. (REQUIRES OMMISSION OF GRAINS CROSSING THE BOUNDARY OF THE IMAGE FIELD)

Parameters

  • image (ndarray) – Binary image.

  • um_per_px (float) – Scaling (um per pixel).

Returns

gc – Number of grains per um^2.

Return type

int

References

1

ASTM E1382−97 (2015) Standard Test Methods for Determining Average Grain Size Using Semiautomatic and Automatic Image Analysis

mftools.measure.grain_size.intersection_count(image, um_per_px, n_scans, min_length)[source]

Perform intersection count method.

Parameters

  • image (ndarray) – Binary image.

  • um_per_px (float) – Scaling (um per pixel).

  • n_scans (int) – Number of randomly orientated line scans to perform.

  • min_length (float) – Minimum scan line length to include in measurements (um).

Returns

ic – List of intersection counts over true length of scan lines.

Return type

list of float

References

1

ASTM E1382−97 (2015) Standard Test Methods for Determining Average Grain Size Using Semiautomatic and Automatic Image Analysis

mftools.measure.grain_size.l_over_a(image, um_per_px)[source]

Perform grain boundary length/area method.

Parameters

  • image (ndarray) – Binary image.

  • um_per_px (float) – Scaling (um per pixel).

Returns

loa – List containing length over area for each grain (excluding grains which intersect the edge of the image field).

Return type

list of float

References

1

ASTM E1382−97 (2015) Standard Test Methods for Determining Average Grain Size Using Semiautomatic and Automatic Image Analysis

mftools.measure.scaling module

Functions for determining micrograph scaling.

mftools.measure.scaling.determine_scaling(image, bar_length_um, bar_frac)[source]

Determine um per pixels scaling for an image provided the bar length in um and the fraction of the image for which it occupies.

Parameters

  • image (ndarray) – Input image. Must be grayscale.

  • bar_length_um (float) – Length of scale bar (um).

  • bar_frac (float) – Fraction of the image width occupied by the scale bar.

Returns

um_per_px – Scaling (um per px).

Return type

float

mftools.measure.volume_fraction module

Functions for detemining volume fraction. Each function takes a binary image as input.

mftools.measure.volume_fraction.vol_frac(image)[source]

Calculate volume fraction of white space in binary image.

Parameters

image (ndarray) – Binary image.

Returns

vf – Percentage white space in image.

Return type

float
